definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: Tourist train was standing-by at Chung-Hsing Station, Hsin-Ying.
sentences.chinese: 新營糖廠中興車站待發中的營長牧場觀光列車。

sentences.english: The battalion commander lined his men along the railway.
sentences.chinese: 營長命令兵士們沿鐵軌排開。

sentences.english: Saw Kyi Aung, Second Commander of KNLA Battalion no. 201, told KIC.
sentences.chinese: 克倫民族解放軍201營副營長蘇吉昂少校稱。

sentences.english: Then I was a brigade liaison officer . After that , I finally became a battalion commander .
sentences.chinese: 然後我當旅部聯絡官，在那之後我終於當上營長。

sentences.english: But I did have good battalion commanders.
sentences.chinese: 我的營長們確實都很不錯。

definition: commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
political commissar (during Russian and Chinese communist revolutions)
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
